content: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?>  <reference anchor='RFC2123'>  <front> <title abbrev='NeTraMet'>Traffic Flow Measurement:  Experiences with NeTraMet</title> <author initials='N.' surname='Brownlee' fullname='Nevil Brownlee'> <organization>The University of Auckland</organization> <address> <phone>+64 9 373 7599 x8941</phone> <email>n.brownlee@auckland.ac.nz</email></address></author> <date year='1997' month='March' /> <area>Operations</area> <keyword>flow measurement</keyword> <abstract> <t>    This memo records experiences in implementing and using the Traffic    Flow Measurement Architecture and Meter MIB. It discusses the    implementation of NeTraMet (a traffic meter) and NeMaC (a combined    manager and meter reader), considers the writing of meter rule sets    and gives some guidance on setting up a traffic flow measurement    system using NeTraMet. </t></abstract></front>  <seriesInfo name='RFC' value='2123' /> <format type='TXT' octets='81874' target='http://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc2123.txt' /> <format type='XML' octets='82362' target='http://xml.resource.org/public/rfc/xml/rfc2123.xml' /> </reference>
